required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevention and Screening for Early Detection of HPV-related Cancers in Gay and Bisexual Men in Tanzania
clinical_study.official_title: Prevention and Screening for Early Detection of HPV-related Cancers in Gay and Bisexual Men in Tanzania

brief_summary.textblock: The long-term objective of the parent study is "to reduce the effects of OPCa through secondary prevention (i.e., early detection, diagnosis and treatment referral)." Consistent with this, this supplement will test HPV-related interventions tailored for Sexual Minority Men (SMM). Acceptability, feasibility and preliminary effectiveness of a smart-phone delivered Oropharyngeal Cancer (OPCA) self-assessment tool will be assessed. Given that homosexuality is stigmatized and criminalized in Tanzania, and that cell phone use is the key way SMM communicate in Tanzania, a self-assessment screening cell phone intervention holds particular promise for SMM in Tanzania but warrants separate evaluation.

primary_outcome.measure: assess screening practices of hrHPV-related OPCa
To assess the acceptability and feasibility of teaching SMM in Tanzania to conduct self-exams
primary_outcome.description: Questionaire to assess post-test selfie evaluations, Scores: 0= was not trained; 1= was trained; 2=took a selfie; 3= clear selfie

primary_outcome.measure: To assess the acceptability and feasibility of hrHPV vaccination
primary_outcome.description: percentage of individuals recruited for aim 1 who request HPV vaccination, Scores are 0=no vaccination; 1=first vaccination; 2= second vaccination; 3=third vaccination

primary_outcome.measure: To assess the acceptability and feasibility of hrHPV vaccination
primary_outcome.description: percentage of individuals recruited for aim 1 who request HPV vaccination, Scores are 0=no vaccination; 1=first vaccination; 2= second vaccination; 3=third vaccination

primary_outcome.measure: To assess the acceptability and feasibility of hrHPV vaccination
primary_outcome.description: percentage of individuals recruited for aim 1 who request HPV vaccination, Scores are 0=no vaccination; 1=first vaccination; 2= second vaccination; 3=third vaccination

arm_group.arm_group_label: Training on self-screening and HPV vaccination administration
arm_group.description: teaching SMM in Tanzania to conduct self-exams for oropharyngeal hrHPV-associated cancers using cellphone-mediated oral selfies, and administering the HPV vaccination series (with 2 and 6-8 month follow-up) to those who request it

intervention.intervention_name: Training on self-screening and HPV vaccination administration
intervention.description: Participants will be taught how to do self-screening for HPV-associated cancers using Training on self-screening and HPV vaccination administration. They will also be given HPV vaccination series.
intervention.arm_group_label: Training on self-screening and HPV vaccination administration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age over 18
- gay or bisexual men
- speak Kiswahili or English
- resident in Dar es Salam
